alert.note: Alert for Central Tangipahoa; Eastern Ascension; Lower Tangipahoa; Northern Livingston; Northern St. Tammany; Southeast St. Tammany; Southern Livingston; Southwestern St. Tammany; St. James; St. John The Baptist (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 19 at 12:28AM CST by NWS New Orleans
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northern St. John The Baptist, east central Ascension, northeastern St. James, St. Tammany, southeastern Livingston and southern Tangipahoa Parishes through 130 AM CST... At 1227 AM CST, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Albany to near Whitehall. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Slidell, Hammond, Covington, Ponchatoula, Abita Springs, Albany, Madisonville, Folsom, Springfield, Sun, Lacombe, Natalbany, Robert, Bush, Whitehall, Killian, Tickfaw and W Lk Pontchartrain Buoy. This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Louisiana between mile markers 190 and 193. Interstate 12 between mile markers 31 and 80. Interstate 55 in Louisiana between mile markers 6 and 36. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
